The current results function doesn't handle more complicated smooths. Also contrasting should be done at the fitting level. Needs to rewrite `results1`.

# Scratchpad
```{r setup}
library(devtools)
library(testthat)
library(microbenchmark)
library(mgcv)
load_all()
# styler::style_file("R/NBAMSeq1.R")
# styler::style_file("R/topTable1.R")

set.seed(1234)
sim1 <- makeExample(n = 30, m = 20)
sim1$id <- factor(seq_along(sim1$pheno))
sim1$f <- factor(rbinom(ncol(sim1), 1, 0.5)) 
sim1@design <- ~ f + s(pheno, by = f) + s(id, bs = "re")

sim_fit <- NBAMSeq1(sim1)
topTable1(sim_fit, coef = "f1", sort.by = "adj.P.Value", number = Inf, adjust.method = "bonferroni")
```

```{r}
sim1@design <- ~ s(pheno)
f1 <- NBAMSeq(sim1)
f2 <- NBAMSeq1(sim1)

r1 <- wrap_results(f1, name = "pheno")
r2 <- topTable1(f2, coef = "s(pheno)", number = Inf)
r1 |> class()
r2[row.names(r1), c("edf", "P.Value")]|> class()
```
